info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SCREVEN, EFFINGHAM, HAMPTON, ALLENDALE AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 530 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Captolo to near Scotia, and moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and excessive cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. All outdoor activities should cease. Move indoors immediately. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Yemassee, Estill, Newington, Furman, Scotia, Coosawhatchie, Lena, and Grays. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Excessive cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 15 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
